There are (I think) two core assumptions baked into my position here. If you disagree with my position, you probably disagree with at least one of these assumptions:

1. The domain of possible knowledge is not finite (but is bounded).
2. Pursuit of knowledge is a motivated task.

Bad framing: ACIP voted to scrap the universal hepatitis B vaccine recommendation for newborns.

Accurate framing: Anti-vax conspiracy theorists appointed to ACIP by Robert Kennedy Jr., who made a fortune as an anti-vax profiteer, voted to expose babies to a preventable, incurable, deadly illness.

Five corporations control 90% of the US media market. 

Airlines merged from 12 major carriers in 1980 to 4 today.

Four giants control 80% of meat processing.

The evidence of corporate consolidation is everywhere.

It means more power for them and less freedom for you.
